name: North Street (Cassandra New North Street)
description: North Street is a moderately active mixed-use street in Cassandra, combining small businesses with residential elements. It serves as a transitional area between quieter residential streets and more socially active locations, making it a common path for investigators moving through town.

snapshot.name: North Street
snapshot.description: North Street features several small but notable establishments clustered along the road. The street is neither crowded nor deserted; foot traffic varies by time of day. The presence of a flower shop, a popular small restaurant, and a rarely open astrologer’s hut gives the area a subtle sense of daily normalcy layered with quiet unease.

characters.name: Nancy Charlotte
characters.notes: Nancy is usually found tending plants in the flower shop during business hours and is aware of visitors entering the area.

characters.name: Helen
characters.notes: Helen runs a small but well-known restaurant. She is attentive to customers and observant of unusual behavior on the street.

conditions.description: Low-level street noise mixed with occasional conversation from shops and diners.
A blend of fresh flowers and cooking aromas drifting through the street.

exits.description: A two-story building housing the flower shop on the ground floor and private rooms above.
A small but popular restaurant that often requires reservations during busy hours.
A small fortune-telling shop next to the flower shop; most of the time it appears closed.

snapshot.keeperNotes: North Street works best as a connective hub. Investigators can naturally encounter multiple NPCs here and choose which lead to pursue without overt pressure.

connections.description: North Street provides direct access to the flower shop and its associated investigations.
Investigators can move from the street into Helen’s Restaurant for social encounters and information gathering.
The astrologer’s hut is a minor but atmospheric location branching off North Street.
